newsitem.title: JAPAN: U.S. more concerned about Japan trade deficit-PM.
newsitem.headline: U.S. more concerned about Japan trade deficit-PM.

text.p: The United States seems to be more concerned about its trade deficit with Japan than the issue of whether Japan will achieve economic growth led by domestic demand, Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto said on Friday.

Asked whether U.S. Vice President Al Gore asked Japan to take steps to ensure domestic demand-led growth, Hashimoto said: "Along with that (issue), the U.S. voiced its concern about its trade deficit with Japan. And I think they were more focused on the latter."
Hashimoto, speaking at a parliamentary committee, was responding to questions about his meeting on Monday in Tokyo with Gore.
Japanese officials had said Gore called on Japan in the meeting to achieve economic growth led by domestic demand.
